intro: Chassalia pentachotoma, commonly known as the five-branched chassalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in clusters. Chassalia pentachotoma is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its distinctive appearance.
